The Golden Reel Ferris Wheel has 17 pods traveling around a figure 8 shaped track and resembling a running 35 film reel! At 425ft high this spectacular structure is the highest in Asia, with stunning views of the South China Sea - it's a real must-do in Macau. The figure 8 track takes 15 minutes to circumnavigate, with each pod holding up to 10 people.

The gigantic kids' play park is a great place for families to start their Macau experience, and with so much to explore your kids will simply not want to leave. The 4 main zones: Dream, Excite, Create and Explore are each equipped with the most innovative facilities that excite and let the kids engage with the park in a safe environment. The more energetic ones can have a blast at the giant futuristic slide 'Peak Adventure', flex their muscles at the climb structure 'Outdoor Explorers' or reach new heights in the 'Bouncy Space'. The park also hosts DIY art workshops and other magical experiences such as a 'Magic Wardrobe' where kids can dress up as their favourite superhero or princess. A must visit for all of the family!

Experience the world of Chibi Maruko-chan, the famed Japanese manga animation, at the 25th Anniversary Exhibition in Macau Until 11 September 2016, enter the animated world of Chibi Maruko-chan at the Macau Convention Centre Browse an exhibit of key frames from author Momoko Sakura and take commemorative photos Experience Maruko's world with reproductions of Maruko's house, classroom, and family life Take home a memento from the range of original merchandise and artwork available for purchase Until 11 September 2016, enter the animated world of Chibi Maruko-chan at the Macau Convention Centre Browse an exhibit of key frames from author Momoko Sakura and take commemorative photos Experience Maruko's world with reproductions of Maruko's house, classroom, and family life Take home a memento from the range of original merchandise and artwork available for purchase What We Love:   What We Love: The beloved Japanese cartoon follows the everyday life of Maruko, a young girl and her family from Shimizu province. Originally a manga comic in 1986 and later an animation television series from 1990, the illustrations are famed not only in Japan, but around the world, and now, for a limited time, the Chibi Maruko-chan exhibition is coming to Macau in celebration of the comic's 25th anniversary. Divided into different zones you'll be able to take a closer look at Maruko's home life, 3rd grade school classroom and the illustrations of author Momoko Sakura. It can't be missed for any Maruko, manga or anime fan!

Enter the world's first live action role play theme park to save a magical kingdom from destruction in this fantasy LARP adventure in Macau Use the 'Magic Scroll' to connect to over 200 games in the theme park Customize your adventure to suit your tastes and experience Solve clues and overcome challenges using a mixture of mental and physical ingenuity Play with friends using one 'Magic Scroll' to navigate your way around the challenges Use the 'Magic Scroll' to connect to over 200 games in the theme park Customize your adventure to suit your tastes and experience Solve clues and overcome challenges using a mixture of mental and physical ingenuity Play with friends using one 'Magic Scroll' to navigate your way around the challenges What We Love:   What We Love: As the 'Chosen One' you are tasked with the most harrowing mission of all time: saving the free and prosperous Magic Stone Kingdom from complete destruction! Move valiantly through all mystical zones and bravely rise to any challenges you encounter throughout this live action role play quest. Use the electronic 'Magic Scroll' with GPS tracking to tackle over 200 original games throughout the theme park, and confront obstacles that challenge your mental and physical aptitude. As part of the first live action role play theme park in the world, you become the protagonist of your own world and drive the storyline in this fun and stimulating adventure.

What We Love:   What We Love: Beyond the glamour of its casino empire, the eclectic beauty and European vibe of Macau are not to be missed. See the best of the far-East's first European settlement in this one-day tour. Visit the dramatic Ruins of St. Paul's and walk through the pedestrianized Senado Square. Savor delicious local and fusion foods. Taste the soaring heights of Macau Tower, then get a sampling of its world-renowned casinos in what is often referred to as the ‘Las Vegas of the East'!

Take the leap from the world's highest commercial bungy jump at Macau Tower. Do you have what it takes? Reach speeds of up to 200km/h after plunging from a height of 233m! Be part of the Guinness World Record by leaping from the 10th tallest freestanding tower and highest commercial bungy jump in the world Using a guide cable system, bungy jumpers will be able to safely experience a few rebounds before slowly landing onto a specially designed airbag Receive a certificate, membership card and exclusive bungy jump t-shirt as part of the package and have the opportunity to purchase a video/photo memento of your experience Reach speeds of up to 200km/h after plunging from a height of 233m! Plunging from a platform 233 meters high, challengers will experience a 4-5 second free-fall before stretching the 50 meter bungy cord and rebounding at 30 meters above the ground. So go on, take a leap from the Macau Tower – be part of the Guinness World Record and show everyone you have what it takes!

The 17-second controlled descent is a less daunting alternative to bungy jumping, but it's still sure to get your heart racing! Jump from the same platform as the bungy and descend feet-first from a height of 233m! By remaining in an upright position the entire way down, without free-falling and rebounding, Skyjump is a less scary option than the bungy With the help of a wire cable, jumpers will be able to safely experience a 17-second descent before slowing down and landing comfortably on their feet Receive a certificate, membership card and exclusive jumpers t-shirt as part of the package and have the opportunity to purchase a video/photo memento of your experience Jump from the same platform as the bungy and descend feet-first from a height of 233m! Your jump takes around 17 seconds before bringing you to a smooth landing at the base of the tower. With no free-falling or rebounding, Skyjump is a more controlled (and less dare-devilish!) alternative to bungy jumping that lets you enjoy spectacular views on your way down. Still unsure? Opt for the tandem jump for that extra encouragement all the way to the bottom!

What We Love:   What We Love: Push your nerves to the limit with this hair-raising adventure: a 360-degree stroll around the outer perimeter of one of the world's tallest towers, 233 meters high! Just 1.8 meters wide and free of handrails, you're secured only by a harness attached to an overhead rail system, with which you'll have the freedom to walk, jump, lean over the edge, and ‘fly' about around the tower itself. Have we mentioned it's a hair-raising adventure?

Walk through exhibits dedicated to outer space, robotics, sound, earth, eco-conservation, sports, and food science. Join a molecular food demo to see spaghetti made from solid milk and tomato soup caviar, and watch a classic science demo: is it possible for a light bulb to shine without electricity? Plus, with a Guinness World Record-awarded, state-of-the-art planetarium – the highest resolution 3D planetarium in the world – you could even find yourself lost in space!

Gain a deeper insight into Taiwanese religion, history and culture with stops at five famous sightseeing spots. See the impressive Chiang Kai-Shek memorial hall, watch the hourly changing of the guard and discover more about the former leader of the Republic of China. A visit to the world's largest and most impressive collection of over 650,000 Chinese art, artifacts and curios is on the cards at the National Palace Museum. You'll swing by the Presidential Office Building, the highest seat of government then get an insight into traditional Taiwanese culture at the Martyrs' Shrine, a dedication to fallen war heroes and set in luscious countryside surrounds. A jam-packed itinerary, but the perfect way to dive into your visit.

Head to the coast for a taste of Taiwan by the sea and a look at the area's spectacular (if somewhat bizarre!) nature Visit Keelung Harbor's magnificent ocean views and the modern architecture of the Service Building Explore Chung Cheng Park for great views and a 25m statue See the amazing geology of Yehliu Park's rock formations, drawing visitors from all over the world Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation Visit Keelung Harbor's magnificent ocean views and the modern architecture of the Service Building Visit Keelung Harbor's magnificent ocean views and the modern architecture of the Service Building Explore Chung Cheng Park for great views and a 25m statue Explore Chung Cheng Park for great views and a 25m statue See the amazing geology of Yehliu Park's rock formations, drawing visitors from all over the world See the amazing geology of Yehliu Park's rock formations, drawing visitors from all over the world Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation What We Love:   What We Love: Venture to the very tip of northern Taiwan, an area embraced by mountains and the Pacific Ocean stretching to the northern horizon. Experience seaside living at Keelung Harbor, a commercial port with a thriving community in a beautiful setting. Pay a visit to Chung Cheng Park, home to the 25-meter Goddess of Mercy statue and offering spectacular views of Keelung and the ocean from its ornate pavilion. The journey continues to Yehliu Geopark – a fascinating coastal rock park featuring some out-of-this-world rock formations, including one that looks like a queen's head!

Head to the neighboring towns of Sansia and Yingge on this afternoon tour showcasing talented potters, colonial architecture and hand-painted artworks Walk Sansia old town street and visit the intricately carved Tsushih Temple Browse the pottery shops and ceramic showrooms in Yingge Visit these beautiful old town feel villages, home to Taiwan's most talented artists Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation Walk Sansia old town street and visit the intricately carved Tsushih Temple Walk Sansia old town street and visit the intricately carved Tsushih Temple Browse the pottery shops and ceramic showrooms in Yingge Browse the pottery shops and ceramic showrooms in Yingge Visit these beautiful old town feel villages, home to Taiwan's most talented artists Visit these beautiful old town feel villages, home to Taiwan's most talented artists Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation What We Love:   What We Love: Spend the afternoon in the crafty districts of Taiwan visiting the country's cultural centers and watching talented artisans at work. Begin in Sansia, a traditional district known for its well preserved Japanese colonial architecture and famed Tsushih Temple, an exquisite example of intricate Chinese temple art and sculpture. Next, head to the famous pottery town of Yingge, boasting several hundred pottery studios and shops. Even today, the village square displays a coal-fire kiln for a landmark! Roam the old pottery street, watch potters at work and shop for your very own unique ceramics.

Take some tips from the Taiwanese and day trip to the northeast coast: spectacular scenery, fascinating geology and a glimpse at a bygone era Explore the once prosperous town of Chiufen, now an interesting historical destination with a unique teahouse culture Visit Pitou Cape with its coastline mottled with caves and sea cliffs Explore the fascinating shoreline and amazing rock formations at Nanya Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation Explore the once prosperous town of Chiufen, now an interesting historical destination with a unique teahouse culture Explore the once prosperous town of Chiufen, now an interesting historical destination with a unique teahouse culture Visit Pitou Cape with its coastline mottled with caves and sea cliffs Visit Pitou Cape with its coastline mottled with caves and sea cliffs Explore the fascinating shoreline and amazing rock formations at Nanya Explore the fascinating shoreline and amazing rock formations at Nanya Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation Tour with a company with over 25 years of experience and an excellent reputation What We Love:   What We Love: The northeast coast of Taiwan is home to verdant scenery, quaint villages and fascinating geography, and is a popular swimming and day trip spot for locals. After a pick up from your hotel, you'll travel by air-conditioned coach to scenic Pitou Cape, lined with caves and sheer overhanging cliff faces, and offering fantastic ocean views. Onwards to Nanya, the area's unique erosion and weathering has created a veritable sculpture garden, with rocks that sport a beautiful striped pattern caused by an oxidation reaction. The village of Chiufen is next on the itinerary. This 1890s gold mining boomtown has since faded into a quaint village you see today, but is well worth visiting for the street snacks, flourishing teahouses and a fascinating glimpse into life during its golden era.

You will hike for about 30 minutes to Rehai, a small cliff popular amongst Taipei rock climbers, and an excellent vantage point for mesmerizing views of Taipei City. Here, you will receive instruction on equipment and the technicalities of rock climbing from friendly, professional rock climbing instructors, who will also give you ample time to practice what you've learned by yourself. The best part? You don't need any prior experience with rock climbing; designed to be suitable for beginners, the Rehai Half Day Climb is a great way to discover the thrill of rock climbing in Taiwan!

Long Dong itself is renowned for its challenging and diverse climb routes, as well as its smooth limestone cliffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean.

On a clear day you can take in some of the best views in Asia and see all the way down to the Taiwan straits, as well as clear views of the mountainous spine of this beautiful island. What's more, you can get to the top in one of the world's fastest elevators arriving at the top in a mere 37 seconds! An incredible feat of engineering, this megastructure is stabilised by an enormous 730 ton damper - an equally impressive sight on the 87th floor.

Enjoy some incredible views of rivers and rift valleys surrounding Taitung, and enjoy the wonder of Taiwan's natural beauty from a new perspective as you take to the skies. As you glide gently through the skies and rise in amongst the clouds wonder at the landscape below you and all around. Then, land back down on earth and be greeted with a celebratory glass of Champagne, and a certificate ensuring the memory of such an incredible experience will be with you to stay.

Either start your trip the evening before and take the night train down to Taitung from Taipei, or start your trip directly in Taitung in the morning. First up, you can choose the extra option of a magical hot air balloon ride over the Taitung countryside, following that is a dip in some local hot springs to work up an appetite for breakfast. Once breakfast is over, learn more about Taiwan at the National Museum of Prehistory and take a stop at the Terrace of the Three Immortals before finishing the trip with a visit to a local Amis aboriginal folk village where you'll learn more about the original inhabitants of Isla Formosa.

You can choose to start your trip the evening before and board the night train down to Taitung from Taipei, or start your trip directly in Taitung in the morning. Start the day with a soothing dip in one of Taiwan's famed hot springs before heading for a tasty local breakfast. Next up is a visit to the tea garden & Longtian village where you will join a cycling tour and discover old Japanese immigrant villages. Enjoy a delicious lunch at the Luminous Hot Spring Resort and finish the day's adventure with a number of stops at interesting local sights such as the Hongye Teenage Baseball Memorial Hall. After an exhausting, action packed day, your guide will then drop you back off safely in downtown Taitung.

strIntroduction: Learn more about Taiwan's ancient aboriginal culture at the Bubun Tribe's cultural village, and then relax in luxurious hot springs Learn more about Taiwan's fascinating ancient history with admission to the National Museum of Prehistory included in the package Attend a sacred and ancient traditional Taiwanese aboriginal choral singing ceremony Enjoy a relaxing massage in the ultra relaxing settings of the M Spa Watch movies whilst bathing in the soothing hot spring pools Learn more about Taiwan's fascinating ancient history with admission to the National Museum of Prehistory included in the package Learn more about Taiwan's fascinating ancient history with admission to the National Museum of Prehistory included in the package Attend a sacred and ancient traditional Taiwanese aboriginal choral singing ceremony Attend a sacred and ancient traditional Taiwanese aboriginal choral singing ceremony Enjoy a relaxing massage in the ultra relaxing settings of the M Spa Enjoy a relaxing massage in the ultra relaxing settings of the M Spa Watch movies whilst bathing in the soothing hot spring pools Watch movies whilst bathing in the soothing hot spring pools What We Love:   What We Love: Discover more of Taiwan's ancient aboriginal culture and learn more about the customs and traditions of Taiwan's 4th largest aboriginal group - the Bunun. With this all inclusive package, board the early morning train from Kaohsiung, or meet directly in Taitung at your own convenience. First up head over to the National Museum of Prehistory where you'll learn more about Taiwan in ancient times. Next is an introduction to the Bunun tribe and their distinct culture. At the cultural village you'll have the opportunity to see a traditional aboriginal choral performance and learn more about Bunun life. End the day with a relaxing soak in the hot springs, and wind down by either watching a movie, or having a professional massage. A great introduction to Taiwan's aboriginal, and hot spring culture!

Truly an experience that everyone should try at least once in their lifetime. Float gracefully up to 50 meters with a stunning panoramic view of the horizon in front and a bird's eye view of the Taitung countryside below. This 10-15 minute taster is perfect for anyone itching to experience the weightlessness of a hot air balloon ride. Throughout the flight you'll be attached by rope to the ground below, making the experience safer and not so affected by wind or other conditions that might delay a normal flight. Start early for spectacular sunrise scenes and make sure you bring a camera with you to capture the amazing views from below you. One thing is for sure, taking a hot air balloon ride in Taitung is an experience you'll certainly want to try again.

Learn more about Taiwan's thriving tea industry and cycle through old Japanese era villages and lush countryside Learn all about the tea farming industry in Taitung and taste a brew in the company of the expert growers of the nearby Luye Tea Plantation Take a bicycle trip through the lush Taitung countryside and pass by picturesque villages and landscapes Stop for a chat and talk with the friendly local tea growers who have been cultivating tea for decades Pass through a number of Japanese 'settlement villages', built during the Japanese colonial era Learn all about the tea farming industry in Taitung and taste a brew in the company of the expert growers of the nearby Luye Tea Plantation Take a bicycle trip through the lush Taitung countryside and pass by picturesque villages and landscapes Stop for a chat and talk with the friendly local tea growers who have been cultivating tea for decades Pass through a number of Japanese 'settlement villages', built during the Japanese colonial era What We Love:   What We Love: Home to some of Taiwan's most famed tea plantations, this fun outdoors experience will give you the most comprehensive introduction to rural Taitung and its iconic tea cultivation industry. Your first stop will be to a tea tasting class with expert tea cultivators showing you the ropes in making the region's iconic brew. Next up you'll hop on a bicycle and enjoy a leisurely guided tour through the Taitung countryside. Along the way discover old Japanese colonial villages and choose to explore the vast expanse of tea fields, having a good chat with the local tea farmers as you go. Then, pass through the idyllic surroundings of Longtian Village, one of Taitung's most unspoilt rural retreats before heading back for a well earned rest!

Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Draped in history and influences from across the world, this tour takes you deeper into Tainan's heritage, history and industry. Visit the Eternal Golden Castle, a fortification against the Japanese completed in 1876 in the western style and restored to its original glory. See the beautiful and well-preserved Merchant house of Tait & Co., evidence of a thriving foreign trade before the Japanese occupation, and the Tree House (an old warehouse) behind. Taste Tainan's famed snacks (reputedly the best in Taiwan) before heading to the huge Wushantou Reservoir, an area of immense beauty and historical significance. Finish at Xinhua Old Street, lined with Baroque-style facades and Japanese-era shop fronts.

Full of fascinating geology, beautiful architecture and romantic nature, not to mention Taiwan's best snacks, this full day tour is sure to show you the best of Tainan Climb atop the 20m salt mountains and look across the salt fields Visit the Black-faced Spoonbill Reserve and bird-watch this near extinct bird (Sep-Mar) Explore the French-designed Eternal Golden Castle, originally built as a fortification against the Japanese Browse the small street stalls for Taiwan's tastiest snacks Glide by boat through mangrove forests creating a romantic green tunnel Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Climb atop the 20m salt mountains and look across the salt fields Climb atop the 20m salt mountains and look across the salt fields Visit the Black-faced Spoonbill Reserve and bird-watch this near extinct bird (Sep-Mar) Visit the Black-faced Spoonbill Reserve and bird-watch this near extinct bird (Sep-Mar) Explore the French-designed Eternal Golden Castle, originally built as a fortification against the Japanese Explore the French-designed Eternal Golden Castle, originally built as a fortification against the Japanese Browse the small street stalls for Taiwan's tastiest snacks Browse the small street stalls for Taiwan's tastiest snacks Glide by boat through mangrove forests creating a romantic green tunnel Glide by boat through mangrove forests creating a romantic green tunnel Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Beginning at the Qigu Salt Mountains, where thousands of tons of salt have piled up to 20 meters high, you can actually climb atop to enjoy fantastic views of the now disused salt fields and surrounds. Visit the black-faced spoonbills at Qigu Lagoon and watch these near-extinct birds wade into the water, sweeping their beaks side-to-side to catch prey. There are sadly only 2,700 of these beautiful white and black birds left in the world, and Taiwan is one of the best places to spot them. A visit to the culinary capital of Taiwan wouldn't be complete without tasting some Tainan snacks from the network of street vendors before heading to the Eternal Golden Castle. This 1876 fortification was created from red bricks and has a decidedly European feel to it. End with a blissful mangrove boat ride where a canopy of green hangs above as you glide through. It's nature at it's finest.

Spend a relaxing day at Wusanto Reservoir and therapeutic Guangzuling Hot Spring Unwind in Guangzuling Hot Springs, mud baths that leave your skin silky smooth Take a walk around Wusanto Resevoir, known for its abundance of small islets and enthralling nature all around View the gorgeous scenery at Taiwan's largest alluvial plain, the Chianan Plain Receive complimentary hotel transfers, mineral water, hot spring admission and insurance all included in the tour Unwind in Guangzuling Hot Springs, mud baths that leave your skin silky smooth Unwind in Guangzuling Hot Springs, mud baths that leave your skin silky smooth Take a walk around Wusanto Resevoir, known for its abundance of small islets and enthralling nature all around Take a walk around Wusanto Resevoir, known for its abundance of small islets and enthralling nature all around View the gorgeous scenery at Taiwan's largest alluvial plain, the Chianan Plain View the gorgeous scenery at Taiwan's largest alluvial plain, the Chianan Plain Receive complimentary hotel transfers, mineral water, hot spring admission and insurance all included in the tour Receive complimentary hotel transfers, mineral water, hot spring admission and insurance all included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Relax and enjoy a therapeutic experience at the Guangzeling Hot Spring, one of Taiwan's four main hot springs. Rather than the water springs seen in the rest of the country, Guangzeling Hot Spring is famous for its mud hot spring, a rare occurrence. Rich in minerals, the mud will leave your skin looking radiant and smooth. You will also visit Wusanto Reservoir, famed for its azure blue waters and the cherry blossom, where you can take a walk around and view over a hundred small islets that are dotted all over the reservoir. Lastly you will witness the epic sceneries offered at Taiwan's largest alluvial plain, Chianan Plain, with lush greenery spread across miles.

Browse through the illustrious Chi Mei Museum, and visit several other landmarks of Tainan Spend hours viewing artefacts and artworks at Chi Mei Museum; spread across five distinct categories Sample traditional Tainan milkfish for lunch, and enjoy several other local snacks, such as rice cakes and meatballs Stop by at several major landmarks of Tainan, such as Chikan Tower, Koxinga Temple and Tainan Confucian Temple Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package Spend hours viewing artefacts and artworks at Chi Mei Museum; spread across five distinct categories Spend hours viewing artefacts and artworks at Chi Mei Museum; spread across five distinct categories Sample traditional Tainan milkfish for lunch, and enjoy several other local snacks, such as rice cakes and meatballs Sample traditional Tainan milkfish for lunch, and enjoy several other local snacks, such as rice cakes and meatballs Stop by at several major landmarks of Tainan, such as Chikan Tower, Koxinga Temple and Tainan Confucian Temple Stop by at several major landmarks of Tainan, such as Chikan Tower, Koxinga Temple and Tainan Confucian Temple Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package What We Love:   What We Love: Built as a celebration of the museum's founder's childhood, Chi Mei Museum consists of five distinct categories: Musical Instruments, Western Art, Natural History, Arms and Armor, and Antiquities. Recognized as one of the most prestigious and diverse collections in the world, it is easy to spend hours at a time inside the museum admiring the various pieces! However, the tour does not stop here; after a lunch of traditional Tainan milkfish, you will have the opportunity to visit several temples and historical sites of Tainan, such as Koxinga Temple, dedicated to the famous Chinese military leader, Chikan Tower, a picturesque fort surrounded with lush gardens, and finally the Tainan Confucian Temple adorned in exquisite religious artefacts. The Confucian Temple and its neighbouring grounds is also where you can sample some of the delicious local snacks, such as rice cakes and meatballs.
strTitle: Chi Mei Museum and Fucheng Food Tour

strIntroduction: Enjoy a day of touring the picturesque Jingliao Village, located in the rural Houbi Township Visit several offbeat cultural and historical sites, such as Huang Family Mansion and Tai'an Palace Explore the real life setting of Let It Be, the 2004 documentary about Taiwanese farmers in Houbi Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package English speaking guides are available for this tour Visit several offbeat cultural and historical sites, such as Huang Family Mansion and Tai'an Palace Visit several offbeat cultural and historical sites, such as Huang Family Mansion and Tai'an Palace Explore the real life setting of Let It Be, the 2004 documentary about Taiwanese farmers in Houbi Explore the real life setting of Let It Be, the 2004 documentary about Taiwanese farmers in Houbi Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package English speaking guides are available for this tour English speaking guides are available for this tour What We Love:   What We Love: Houbi Township is a rural region in the north of Tainan county, and once known to be the thriving centre of the orchid cultivation industry. Centered around Jingliao Village, a quiet and quaint place, this full day tour gives you a deep insight into the rural districts of Taiwan. With visits to historical landmarks, such as the mysterious Huang Family Mansion and Tai'an Palace, you will marvel at sights that few have seen, as they are often not found in tourist guides. You will also get to explore the place where the critically acclaimed documentary Let It Be was shot; recording the lives of several farmers around Houbi, you will be able to see the farmers at work first hand during your trip to Jingliao Village.

Pick and eat exotic fruits with a backdrop of mountainous countryside at Siraya National Scenic Area Take in the views of mountains and farms at Siraya National Scenic Area, one of Taiwan's 13 designated scenic areas Go fruit picking for juicy mangoes and longans Visit several temples and historical sites along the way on the tour Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package Take in the views of mountains and farms at Siraya National Scenic Area, one of Taiwan's 13 designated scenic areas Go fruit picking for juicy mangoes and longans Visit several temples and historical sites along the way on the tour Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package What We Love:   What We Love: Siraya National Scenic Area is one if thirteen natural scenic areas in Taiwan, established in 2005, named after the indigenious Siraya ethnic group. Famous for being a major farm produce region, the area is abundant is all sorts of exotic fruits, such as Chinese honey oranges, longans and mangoes. You will have the chance to pick your own fruit with this family-favourite activity, and can enjoy the fruits of your labor afterwards. With towering mountains covering the land, hot springs hidden away in the quaint valleys and beautiful temples along the path, Siraya National Scenic Area has a truly magical feel to it.
strTitle: Fruit Picking at Siraya National Scenic Area

strIntroduction: Discover some of the most interesting sites of Tainan city at night, along with a Michelin-worthy meal Indulge in some gourmet treats at Bistro Alley, a foodie's paradise for delicious Taiwanese-fused French and Italian specialties Walk through some of Tainan's landmarks; Pan Palace Shihfang, National Museum of Taiwanese Literature and Maxwell Memorial Presbyterian Church Shop at Forest Department Store, Taiwan's second oldest department store Indulge in some gourmet treats at Bistro Alley, a foodie's paradise for delicious Taiwanese-fused French and Italian specialties Indulge in some gourmet treats at Bistro Alley, a foodie's paradise for delicious Taiwanese-fused French and Italian specialties Walk through some of Tainan's landmarks; Pan Palace Shihfang, National Museum of Taiwanese Literature and Maxwell Memorial Presbyterian Church Walk through some of Tainan's landmarks; Pan Palace Shihfang, National Museum of Taiwanese Literature and Maxwell Memorial Presbyterian Church Shop at Forest Department Store, Taiwan's second oldest department store Shop at Forest Department Store, Taiwan's second oldest department store What We Love:   What We Love: An enthralling journey through the historic city of Tainan, this tour fuses the east with the west in a unique and special way. Starting at the sacred Tainan Confucian Temple, you will venture through Pan Palace Shifang, a square in the city with four towering arches forming the edges. You will then explore the National Museum of Taiwanese Literature, a building that has been praised for its intriguing, modernistic architecture, followed by a visit to Maxwell Memorial Presbyterian Church, a gleaming white structure. However, the highlight of the trip is Bistro Alley, a small restaurant nestled away in a narrow street, serving Michelin star-worthy Italian and French cuisines with a hint of Taiwanese fusion. With a satisfied belly, indulge in some retail therapy at Taiwan's second oldest department store.

Spend the day exploring the cultural sights at Fo Guang Shan including the huge Buddha statue and tranquil Cheng Ching Lake Visit Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Memorial Centre, home to some of the relics of Gautama Buddha and a colossal, unforgettable Buddha statue Explore the bustling stalls surrounding Fo Guang Shan, abundant in traditional souvenirs and religious trinkets Enjoy a relaxing afternoon at Cheng Ching Lake, and walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, plus insurance and mineral water included in the tour Visit Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Memorial Centre, home to some of the relics of Gautama Buddha and a colossal, unforgettable Buddha statue Visit Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Memorial Centre, home to some of the relics of Gautama Buddha and a colossal, unforgettable Buddha statue Explore the bustling stalls surrounding Fo Guang Shan, abundant in traditional souvenirs and religious trinkets Explore the bustling stalls surrounding Fo Guang Shan, abundant in traditional souvenirs and religious trinkets Enjoy a relaxing afternoon at Cheng Ching Lake, and walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns Enjoy a relaxing afternoon at Cheng Ching Lake, and walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, plus insurance and mineral water included in the tour Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, plus insurance and mineral water included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: As one of the most venerated Buddhist sites in Taiwan, the Fo Guang Shan Buddhish Memorial Centre cannot be missed. You are greeted by a colossal Buddha statue upon climbing the stairs towards the centre. One of the most fascinating aspects of Fo Guang Shan is that it is home to a relic of Gautama Buddha, the founder of the Buddhist faith. On leaving the temple, the surrounding cluster of lively stalls selling souvenirs and scriptures is well worth a roam. After an afternoon at Fo Guang Shan, cool off by the Cheng Ching Lake, with scenic sights all around such as the chateau of one of Taiwan's former presidents that looks over the waters, and Phu Quoc Island situated within the lake. Make sure to walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns to get breathtaking views of Cheng Ching Lake and its surroundings.
strTitle: Fo Guang Shan and Cheng Ching Lake

strIntroduction: Discover the many wonders of Zuoying District, including the famous Lotus Pond Walk around the Lotus Pond, named for the beautiful, lush lotus plants scattered over the surface Discover the many temples and pagodas surrounding the Lotus Pond, especially the ornate Spring and Autumn Pavillions Explore other noteworthy landmarks in Zuoying, such as the Old City and the National Stadium Feast on the local snacks available at Lotus Park, such as Ben Beef noodles and Gong Carrabolla soup Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included Walk around the Lotus Pond, named for the beautiful, lush lotus plants scattered over the surface Walk around the Lotus Pond, named for the beautiful, lush lotus plants scattered over the surface Discover the many temples and pagodas surrounding the Lotus Pond, especially the ornate Spring and Autumn Pavillions Discover the many temples and pagodas surrounding the Lotus Pond, especially the ornate Spring and Autumn Pavillions Explore other noteworthy landmarks in Zuoying, such as the Old City and the National Stadium Explore other noteworthy landmarks in Zuoying, such as the Old City and the National Stadium Feast on the local snacks available at Lotus Park, such as Ben Beef noodles and Gong Carrabolla soup Feast on the local snacks available at Lotus Park, such as Ben Beef noodles and Gong Carrabolla soup Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included What We Love:   What We Love: Zuoying District has a lot to offer its many visitors, with one of the most sought-after sites being the Lotus Pond. This man-made lake plays habitat to a variety of exotic lotus plants, as well as temples and pagodas scattered all over the perimeter of the lake, you'll really get the feeling of being somewhere mystical. One of the most noteworthy sites across its shores are the Spring and Autumn Pavilions, marvelous sights on their own, but also an excellent vantage point for those who want to view the lake. The tour also takes you to the walls of the Old City of Zuoying, as well as the National Stadium, the largest stadium in Taiwan. Make sure to try the many food specialties at Lotus Pond, especially the scrumptious Ben Beef noodles!

Explore the lively, bustling port city of Kaohsiung on this evening tour Witness awe-inspiring views of the Kaohsiung Harbor at the British Consulate Residence Cruise down the Love River, with plenty of sights lined across the river banks Treat yourself to some fresh seafood and traditional souvenirs at Liouhe Night Market Tour is inclusive of hotel transfers, insurance and mineral water Witness awe-inspiring views of the Kaohsiung Harbor at the British Consulate Residence Witness awe-inspiring views of the Kaohsiung Harbor at the British Consulate Residence Cruise down the Love River, with plenty of sights lined across the river banks Cruise down the Love River, with plenty of sights lined across the river banks Treat yourself to some fresh seafood and traditional souvenirs at Liouhe Night Market Treat yourself to some fresh seafood and traditional souvenirs at Liouhe Night Market Tour is inclusive of hotel transfers, insurance and mineral water Tour is inclusive of hotel transfers, insurance and mineral water What We Love:   What We Love: The Kaohsiung Night Tour comprises of three main locations, each with a unique vibe of its own; the first stop is the British Consulate Residence, sitting atop a hill and providing visitors with breathtaking views of Kaohsiung Harbor and its surrounding area. You will then cruise down Love River, which is lined with parks as well as some of the city's most treasured landmarks, such as the Holy Rosary Cathedral. After the boat ride, indulge in delicious seafood, as well as all kinds of traditional handicrafts and clothing at the Liouhe Night Market, which marks the end of the tour.

second largest city in Taiwan, Kaoshiung is a bustling place, with an intriguing blend of old and new. This tour showcases exactly that; the old is reflected in the visit to Qijin Island, which houses the Qihou Lighthouse, a white baroque-style Japanese construction, which contrasts with Qihou Fort, a Chinese-style monument. For a taste of contemporary Taiwan, head over to Pier2 Art Center, an old warehouse converted into a creative hub for the city's modern artists. Witness some of the most panaromic views that Kaoshiung has to offer at the British Consulate Residence, as well as from the boat ride down the Love River, arguably the most preferred way to view the city by night. End your Kaoshiung experience at the Gold Diamond Kai-Shuan Night Market, the largest market in the area, famed for its trademark papaya milkshakes and succulent steamed shrimp.

Discover Hakka and aboriginal culture on a day trip through Meinong and Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park Learn about Hakka culture by visiting Meinong Township and its many sights, such as East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions Sample some Hakka specialties, such as flat noodles, stewed winter lemon and wild lotus Visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, a beautiful and natural area that preserves the history of aboriginal culture Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included Learn about Hakka culture by visiting Meinong Township and its many sights, such as East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions Learn about Hakka culture by visiting Meinong Township and its many sights, such as East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions Sample some Hakka specialties, such as flat noodles, stewed winter lemon and wild lotus Sample some Hakka specialties, such as flat noodles, stewed winter lemon and wild lotus Visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, a beautiful and natural area that preserves the history of aboriginal culture Visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, a beautiful and natural area that preserves the history of aboriginal culture Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included What We Love:   What We Love: Learn about two fascinating and unique cultures in this full day tour. Start off at Meinong, home to Hakka culture, and well preserved through landmarks such as the illustrious East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions. To really get a feel of the Hakka lifestyle, venture into the Meinong Folk Village, and try the delicious local delicacies such as flat noodles and stewed winter melon. Next, visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, which plays host to a cluster of aboriginal villages. With no modern establishments in sight, and nature all around, the park is the perfect place to discover some inner peace, as well as learn about the extraordinary aboriginal culture firsthand by visiting the park's many tribal cabins, which house aboriginal handicrafts and wax works. Or simply stroll around the park to bask in the beautiful, natural environment.

Witness Tainan's most revered cultural and historical landmarks in a night tour of the city Walk around Fort Provintia, an old Dutch fort, surrounded by peaceful and picturesque gardens Marvel at the religious iconography at Xiaonan City God Temple, one of the most frequented temples in the city Witness several interesting collections of artifacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum Enjoy hotel pickup and dinner, included in the tour package Walk around Fort Provintia, an old Dutch fort, surrounded by peaceful and picturesque gardens Walk around Fort Provintia, an old Dutch fort, surrounded by peaceful and picturesque gardens Marvel at the religious iconography at Xiaonan City God Temple, one of the most frequented temples in the city Marvel at the religious iconography at Xiaonan City God Temple, one of the most frequented temples in the city Witness several interesting collections of artifacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum Witness several interesting collections of artifacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum Enjoy hotel pickup and dinner, included in the tour package Enjoy hotel pickup and dinner, included in the tour package What We Love:   What We Love: As the oldest city in Taiwan, Tainan is a haven for history buffs, with plenty of intriguing landmarks, dedicated to culture and religion. This night tour takes you to three of the most revered sites of Tainan; after dinner, you will first be taken to Fort Provinitia, also known as Chickan Towers, which contains softly-lit Chinese-style towers built upon a Dutch fort surrounded by a picturesque Japanese garden, complete with a koi fish pond. Known to be one of the prettiest sites in Tainan, Fort Provintia is an excellent way to start your tour, which then takes you to Xiaonan City God Temple, an elaborate structure adorned with hundreds of images of soldiers and dragons. Finally, you can view some folk artefacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum; built upon an area that was once Tainan's business centre, the museum itself has a history as inspiring as the collections contained inside.

Take a day - or two - to discover the natural beauty of Alishan and become acquainted with the talented Tsou tribe Drive by the quaint towns and beautiful scenery of Chiayi County Explore Alishan's nature including bamboo forests, sparkling waterfalls and tea plantations Enjoy a tasty aboriginal lunch before a traditional performance from the colorful Tsou tribe Opt for the two day tour to also watch Alishan's famed sunrise and pay a visit to Fenqihu Old Street and the Everlasting Bridge Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Drive by the quaint towns and beautiful scenery of Chiayi County Drive by the quaint towns and beautiful scenery of Chiayi County Explore Alishan's nature including bamboo forests, sparkling waterfalls and tea plantations Explore Alishan's nature including bamboo forests, sparkling waterfalls and tea plantations Enjoy a tasty aboriginal lunch before a traditional performance from the colorful Tsou tribe Enjoy a tasty aboriginal lunch before a traditional performance from the colorful Tsou tribe Opt for the two day tour to also watch Alishan's famed sunrise and pay a visit to Fenqihu Old Street and the Everlasting Bridge Opt for the two day tour to also watch Alishan's famed sunrise and pay a visit to Fenqihu Old Street and the Everlasting Bridge Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Known for its pillowy cloud seas, spectacular sunrises, glowing sunsets, enchanting forests and charming railway, it's no wonder Alishan is a popular day (or weekend) trip for tourists and locals like. Get to know the indigenous Tsou people with a traditional aboriginal meal followed by a tribal dance performance. Then explore this mountain park full of cherry blossom and bamboo forests, glittering waterfalls, hiking trails and high altitude tea plantations. Opt for the two-day tour for your chance to experience the famed Alishan sunrise, Fenqihu's quaint old street and a seemingly never-ending suspension bridge.

Enjoy a day exploring the underrated sites of Yunlin County and the area's fantastic nature Take a trip to the wetlands, home to a diverse range of bird species, such as the water thrush and short-eared owl Visit the house of the late Zheng Fengxi, a celebrated Taiwanese novelist Explore Haikou neighborhood, a fishing village famous for its variety of seafood Enjoy the sceneries of the river and plains throughout your tour of Yunlin Enjoy complimentary hotel transfers, as well as lunch, admission tickets and insurance, all included in the tour Take a trip to the wetlands, home to a diverse range of bird species, such as the water thrush and short-eared owl Take a trip to the wetlands, home to a diverse range of bird species, such as the water thrush and short-eared owl Visit the house of the late Zheng Fengxi, a celebrated Taiwanese novelist Visit the house of the late Zheng Fengxi, a celebrated Taiwanese novelist Explore Haikou neighborhood, a fishing village famous for its variety of seafood Explore Haikou neighborhood, a fishing village famous for its variety of seafood Enjoy the sceneries of the river and plains throughout your tour of Yunlin Enjoy the sceneries of the river and plains throughout your tour of Yunlin Enjoy complimentary hotel transfers, as well as lunch, admission tickets and insurance, all included in the tour Enjoy complimentary hotel transfers, as well as lunch, admission tickets and insurance, all included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Yunlin County may not be quite as frequented as its neighbouring counties, but that is perhaps because it offers experiences that are better suited to travellers looking for something more off-beat; nature lovers will be left in awe of the rare bird species, such as the waterthrush and short-eared owl that you can find at the wetlands, and literary buffs will be fascinated to visit the house of the late Zheng Fengxi, a novelist who was amongst Taiwan's “Ten Outstanding Youths.” You will also visit Haikou, a quaint fishing neighbourhood where you can find a huge variety of fresh seafood, such as clams, shrimp and oysters. While still quite an underdeveloped region, Yunlin offers unforgettable sceneries, especially alongside the river and the lush Chianan Plain.

Tour this special part of Taiwan and discover the area's significance for art, architecture and the salt-making industry Glide through the famous green tunnel canopy then go bird watching for the rare black-faced spoonbill See the beautiful modern architecture of Beimen Crystal Church Visit paintings of famed Taiwanese painter Hung Tung and learn about his unique style, use of vivid color and influence on modern art Marvel at the patchwork reflections across Jingzaijiao salt fields and learn how salt was traditionally made in the area Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package Glide through the famous green tunnel canopy then go bird watching for the rare black-faced spoonbill Glide through the famous green tunnel canopy then go bird watching for the rare black-faced spoonbill See the beautiful modern architecture of Beimen Crystal Church See the beautiful modern architecture of Beimen Crystal Church Visit paintings of famed Taiwanese painter Hung Tung and learn about his unique style, use of vivid color and influence on modern art Visit paintings of famed Taiwanese painter Hung Tung and learn about his unique style, use of vivid color and influence on modern art Marvel at the patchwork reflections across Jingzaijiao salt fields and learn how salt was traditionally made in the area Marvel at the patchwork reflections across Jingzaijiao salt fields and learn how salt was traditionally made in the area Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, lunch, insurance and mineral water all included in the tour package What We Love:   What We Love: Join this unique tour in and around Beimen District, sighting fascinating landmarks far removed from the usual tourist trail. Begin with a graceful boat ride beneath the arching mangroves of Sicao Green Tunnel, then try a spot of birdwatching for the endangered black-faced spoonbill, only found in a few parts of the world. Next you'll visit the area's most romantic building, Beimen Crystal Church. The modern architecture and romantic atmosphere make this a popular photo shoot location for newlywed couples. Discover the artwork of Hung Tung, a self-taught Taiwanese artist whose colorful abstract style heavily influenced Taiwanese modern art in the 1970s, before coming to the Jingzaijiao salt fields. Tainan used to be Taiwan's most important salt-making area but the flats are now abandoned is favor of cheaper imported salt. A few are maintained for tourism purposes so you can still watch and learn about traditional salt-drying methods.

With possible sightings of 29 different species of cetaceans (whales and dolphins), chances are high for a fantastic marine display off Taiwan's east coast Sight a range of whale species including humpback, killer, sperm, false killer and pygmy killer whales Watch playful dolphins of species such as spinner, bottlenose, pantropical spotted and Chinese white dolphins Enjoy the guidance of a local fisherman to the best whale and dolphin sighting spots Relax and enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour Ruisui and Hualien pick up available, please contact us for quotes Sight a range of whale species including humpback, killer, sperm, false killer and pygmy killer whales Sight a range of whale species including humpback, killer, sperm, false killer and pygmy killer whales Watch playful dolphins of species such as spinner, bottlenose, pantropical spotted and Chinese white dolphins Watch playful dolphins of species such as spinner, bottlenose, pantropical spotted and Chinese white dolphins Enjoy the guidance of a local fisherman to the best whale and dolphin sighting spots Enjoy the guidance of a local fisherman to the best whale and dolphin sighting spots Relax and enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour Relax and enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour Ruisui and Hualien pick up available, please contact us for quotes Ruisui and Hualien pick up available, please contact us for quotes What We Love:   What We Love: Home to 29 species of cetaceans (whales and dolphins) - an even more impressive fact when you realize there are only 60 species in the world – it's no wonder Taiwan's waters are a fantastic whale watching location. Cruise along the east coast in the hope of sighting a number of whale species including killer whales, humpback whales and sperm whales. Spot a tail splashing into the sea, watch them launch themselves out of the water or send jets from their blowholes. Not to mention the abundance of dolphins you're sure to sight. With everything from bottlenose, Chinese white, spinner and Risso's dolphins which dance in and out of the waves in large groups just feet from your boat. Watch these incredible creatures with the beautiful cliff coastline as your backdrop - it's a truly magical sight to behold!

Nature lovers get ready – for Taiwan's stunning Taroko Gorge. Roaring rivers, tranquil mountain shrines, canyon suspension bridges and scenic beaches await at this beautiful National Park Venture along the Swallows' Grotto Trail for the most dramatic view of the gorge Get lunch at Tianxiang and visit the town's iconic red suspension bridge Visit the eternal springs at Changchun Shrine, burrowed into the hillside Take in the ocean air at Qixingtan and the pebble stone beach or find peace in the tranquil plains of Buluowan tribal village Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off and optional lunch Venture along the Swallows' Grotto Trail for the most dramatic view of the gorge Venture along the Swallows' Grotto Trail for the most dramatic view of the gorge Get lunch at Tianxiang and visit the town's iconic red suspension bridge Get lunch at Tianxiang and visit the town's iconic red suspension bridge Visit the eternal springs at Changchun Shrine, burrowed into the hillside Visit the eternal springs at Changchun Shrine, burrowed into the hillside Take in the ocean air at Qixingtan and the pebble stone beach or find peace in the tranquil plains of Buluowan tribal village Take in the ocean air at Qixingtan and the pebble stone beach or find peace in the tranquil plains of Buluowan tribal village Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off and optional lunch Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off and optional lunch What We Love:   What We Love: Take a private day tour to what is arguably Taiwan's most scenic destination, Taroko National Park. Showcasing a diverse range of nature and wildlife: travel from rugged coast, to luscious forest, to the dramatic cliff faces of 19km Taroko Gorge. Delve into the heart of the park at the Swallow Grotto Trail, interspersed with tunnels and the best viewpoint for overlooking the narrowest part of the gorge, where the river is at its most dramatic. After lunch in scenic Tianxiang, you'll visit the Changchung Shrine (or the Eternal Spring Shrine), a beautiful temple nestled within the hillside, atop a waterfall stream that supposedly never stops running (hence the name of the shrine). Before ending at Qixingtan, famed for its pebble beach and fantastic views of the Pacific Ocean.

Discover the true beauty of Hualien's inland nature and gain an insight into the former thriving industries created as a result of the Japanese occupation Explore Hualien's logging heritage at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center Visit Butterfly Valley at the Fuyuan National Forest Recreation Area in spectacular nature surrounds Get your sugar fix by sampling ice creams at the Hualien Sugar Factory Enjoy a tasty lunch and freshly produced milk tasting included in the tour Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Explore Hualien's logging heritage at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center Explore Hualien's logging heritage at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center Visit Butterfly Valley at the Fuyuan National Forest Recreation Area in spectacular nature surrounds Visit Butterfly Valley at the Fuyuan National Forest Recreation Area in spectacular nature surrounds Get your sugar fix by sampling ice creams at the Hualien Sugar Factory Get your sugar fix by sampling ice creams at the Hualien Sugar Factory Enjoy a tasty lunch and freshly produced milk tasting included in the tour Enjoy a tasty lunch and freshly produced milk tasting included in the tour Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Begin at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center, a once thriving logging town in lush mountain surrounds that has fallen into abandonment in recent years, but which remains a fascinating place to see the traces of a thriving Chinese cypress lumber industry: disused machinery and tools, an old timber railway and Japanese-style architecture from the days of occupation. Continue to the Butterfly Valley where over 30 of the colorful creatures flit between camphor trees, waterfalls, steep valleys and magnificent views. A delicious lunch is provided then a chance to taste the freshest high-quality milk as you sit outdoors at Ruisui Pasture. The tour ends on a sweet note, with a visit to Hualien Sugar Factory. A popular stop to sample all manner of flavored popsicles and ice cream and to visit the neat rows of Japanese-style bungalows built for workers during the Japanese occupation.

Discover evidence of Japanese culture alongside modern Taiwanese creativity in this tour of Hualien's unique eastern coast See the only Grade III historic site on Taiwan's East Coast: Jian Chinxiu Temple Visit Hualien's Creative and Cultural Park, a hub for modern creatives in a renovated industrial setting Pause for thought at some of Taiwan's most beautiful lakes and stunning scenery Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off See the only Grade III historic site on Taiwan's East Coast: Jian Chinxiu Temple See the only Grade III historic site on Taiwan's East Coast: Jian Chinxiu Temple Visit Hualien's Creative and Cultural Park, a hub for modern creatives in a renovated industrial setting Visit Hualien's Creative and Cultural Park, a hub for modern creatives in a renovated industrial setting Pause for thought at some of Taiwan's most beautiful lakes and stunning scenery Pause for thought at some of Taiwan's most beautiful lakes and stunning scenery Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: During the Japanese occupation, the influx of Japanese immigrants was particularly great in the Hualien area, a period of history that is still very much in evidence today. This half-day tour takes you on a journey to discover these touches of Japanese style and architecture, which have created a beautiful fusion of heritage, unique to the east coast. Begin at Jian Chinxiu Temple, a traditional Japanese Takono-style temple built for the large number of Japanese in the area in 1917. Onwards to Liyu Lake where, on a clear day, the mirror-like reflections of Liyu mountain and the cotton clouds above make for spectacular photos. Get your final culture fix at the Hualien Creative and Cultural Park. Housed in a former Japanese winery, this collection of contemporary galleries, exhibition halls, boutique shops, teahouses and artist residences showcase cutting-edge Taiwanese art and creativity in a modern factory restoration.

A theme park with a difference – Farglory Ocean Park provides visitors with not only exciting attractions but also excellent shows themed on marine ecology Get the best of a marine park and a theme park in one 51-hectare location Ride exciting rollercoasters, flume rides and other awesome attractions Watch marine-theme shows and visit the impressive aquarium Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Get the best of a marine park and a theme park in one 51-hectare location Get the best of a marine park and a theme park in one 51-hectare location Ride exciting rollercoasters, flume rides and other awesome attractions Ride exciting rollercoasters, flume rides and other awesome attractions Watch marine-theme shows and visit the impressive aquarium Watch marine-theme shows and visit the impressive aquarium Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Entertain the whole family at Taiwan's first theme- and nature-park hybrid. Farglory Ocean Park offers visitors an exciting selection of rides and shows with a focus on marine ecology. Must-see attractions include the widely acclaimed Dolphin and Sea Lion shows and the impressive aquarium. Thrill-seekers should head for the rollercoaster and flume ride or indoors to watch the incredible dance and acrobatics show. Rise to the skies of the ferris wheel or cable car for spectacular views across the Pacific Ocean. Then bring things back to earth in time for the park's carnivalesque parade. With the backdrop of the castle-like hotel and in tropical nature surrounds, this park is a veritable wonderland for a thrill-filled family day out.

For a day of fun (and some environmental education too), bring the family to explore the acres of land used for eco-farming, an animal zoo, an aviary and even a pool and hot springs Learn more about cow farming and even watch a milking demonstration Kids will love the petting zoo, ponies and kids playing areas Rent bikes or an electric car to explore the resort with environmental-friendly ease Relax at the end of the day in the hot springs or swimming pool (extra cost) Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Learn more about cow farming and even watch a milking demonstration Learn more about cow farming and even watch a milking demonstration Kids will love the petting zoo, ponies and kids playing areas Kids will love the petting zoo, ponies and kids playing areas Rent bikes or an electric car to explore the resort with environmental-friendly ease Rent bikes or an electric car to explore the resort with environmental-friendly ease Relax at the end of the day in the hot springs or swimming pool (extra cost) Relax at the end of the day in the hot springs or swimming pool (extra cost) Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Demonstrating that eco-living is well within our reach and promoting farming and dairy culture, the Shin Kong Chao Feng Ranch & Resort is an ideal family day out – and great for giving the kids some environmental education. This incredible ecological park in the heart of Hualien and surrounded by spectacular mountain views, is jam-packed with activities to entertain. Take a stroll through the European-style landscaped garden or visit the Dutch windmill and flower gardens. Roam the 70 hectares of pastureland and say hello to the calves at the cow nursery. Help out with raccoon feeding time, pet the rabbits or walk through the birds of paradise aviary. You can navigate the huge park with an eco-friendly transport option by renting a bike or electric car, or by hopping aboard the passenger train. Then, at the end of an active day, relax in the hot springs whilst the kids splash about in the swimming pool.
strTitle: Shin Kong Chao Feng Ranch & Eco-Resort

strIntroduction: This tour of Taiwan's East Coast showcases the most beautiful locations and remarkable natural sights along one of the world's most spectacular coastlines Explore the impressive gorge and beautiful surrounding farmlands of Fanshuliao Walk the ‘stone stairs' of Shihtiping and visit the fishing harbor of Shihti (eyes peeled for whales and dolphins in the distance!) Relax over tranquil views of the Pacific coastline and discover aboriginal art at Niushan Huting and Baqi Gazebo Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Explore the impressive gorge and beautiful surrounding farmlands of Fanshuliao Explore the impressive gorge and beautiful surrounding farmlands of Fanshuliao Walk the ‘stone stairs' of Shihtiping and visit the fishing harbor of Shihti (eyes peeled for whales and dolphins in the distance!) Walk the ‘stone stairs' of Shihtiping and visit the fishing harbor of Shihti (eyes peeled for whales and dolphins in the distance!) Relax over tranquil views of the Pacific coastline and discover aboriginal art at Niushan Huting and Baqi Gazebo Relax over tranquil views of the Pacific coastline and discover aboriginal art at Niushan Huting and Baqi Gazebo Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Beginning at Fanshuliao Valley, you'll be immediately confronted with the dramatic topography of a hundred-meter gorge cutting through the mountains at this unique canyon. The area is dotted with quaint cottages on riverside farmlands with undulating hill vistas beyond. Shihtiping showcases the best of Taiwan's coastal geology, where sea erosion has smoothed the volcanic rock, forcing it to immerge into layers resembling stone steps. Stop by the beautifully constructed Taroko Bridge before visiting Shihti Harbor, a working fishing village and the gateway to whale and dolphin sightings in Taiwan – so keep your eyes peeled! The tour ends with two of Taiwan's most tranquil spots: Baqi Gazebo and Niushan Huting. Both provide an undisturbed setting for blissful viewpoints across the Pacific coastline and the coastal mountain range, with lush grasslands dotted with aboriginal sculptures and handicrafts.
strTitle: Beautiful Nature of the East Coast
